info.title: Google Compute Engine Instance Groups API
info.description: The Resource View API allows users to create and manage logical sets of Google Compute Engine instances.

get.description: Retrieves the specified zone-specific operation resource.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: Name of the operation resource to return.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Name of the project scoping this request.

parameters.name: zone
parameters.description: Name of the zone scoping this request.

get.description: Retrieves the list of operation resources contained within the specified zone.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Optional. Filter expression for filtering listed resources.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: Optional. Maximum count of results to be returned. Maximum value is 500 and default value is 500.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: Optional. Tag returned by a previous list request truncated by maxResults. Used to continue a previous list request.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Name of the project scoping this request.

parameters.name: zone
parameters.description: Name of the zone scoping this request.

parameters.description: The project name of the resource view.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The project name of the resource view.

parameters.name: resourceView
parameters.description: The name of the resource view.

parameters.name: zone
parameters.description: The zone name of the resource view.

post.description: Get the service information of a resource view or a resource.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The project name of the resource view.

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: The name of the resource if user wants to get the service information of the resource.

parameters.name: resourceView
parameters.description: The name of the resource view.

parameters.name: zone
parameters.description: The zone name of the resource view.

parameters.description: The project name of the resource view.

parameters.name: zone
parameters.description: The zone name of the resource view.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: Maximum count of results to be returned. Acceptable values are 0 to 5000, inclusive. (Default: 5000)

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: Specifies a nextPageToken returned by a previous list request. This token can be used to request the next page of results from a previous list request.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The project name of the resource view.

parameters.name: zone
parameters.description: The zone name of the resource view.

get.description: List the resources of the resource view.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The requested format of the return value. It can be URL or URL_PORT. A JSON object will be included in the response based on the format. The default format is NONE, which results in no JSON in the response.

parameters.name: listState
parameters.description: The state of the instance to list. By default, it lists all instances.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: Maximum count of results to be returned. Acceptable values are 0 to 5000, inclusive. (Default: 5000)

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: Specifies a nextPageToken returned by a previous list request. This token can be used to request the next page of results from a previous list request.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The project name of the resource view.

parameters.name: resourceView
parameters.description: The name of the resource view.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The service name to return in the response. It is optional and if it is not set, all the service end points will be returned.

parameters.name: zone
parameters.description: The zone name of the resource view.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The project name of the resource view.

parameters.name: resourceView
parameters.description: The name of the resource view.

parameters.description: The zone name of the resource view.

parameters.name: resourceView

Label.description: The Label to be applied to the resource views.

ListResourceResponseItem.description: The list response item that contains the resource and end points information.

endpoints.description: The list of service end points on the resource.

additionalProperties.description: The name of the service end point.

resource.description: The full URL of the resource.

Operation.description: An operation resource, used to manage asynchronous API requests.

clientOperationId.description: [Output only] An optional identifier specified by the client when the mutation was initiated. Must be unique for all operation resources in the project.

creationTimestamp.description: [Output Only] The time that this operation was requested, in RFC3339 text format.

endTime.description: [Output Only] The time that this operation was completed, in RFC3339 text format.

error.description: [Output Only] If errors occurred during processing of this operation, this field will be populated.

errors.description: [Output Only] The array of errors encountered while processing this operation.

code.description: [Output Only] The error type identifier for this error.

location.description: [Output Only] Indicates the field in the request which caused the error. This property is optional.

message.description: [Output Only] An optional, human-readable error message.

httpErrorMessage.description: [Output only] If operation fails, the HTTP error message returned.

httpErrorStatusCode.description: [Output only] If operation fails, the HTTP error status code returned.

id.description: [Output Only] Unique identifier for the resource, generated by the server.

insertTime.description: [Output Only] The time that this operation was requested, in RFC3339 text format.

operationType.description: [Output only] Type of the operation. Operations include insert, update, and delete.

progress.description: [Output only] An optional progress indicator that ranges from 0 to 100. There is no requirement that this be linear or support any granularity of operations. This should not be used to guess at when the operation will be complete. This number should be monotonically increasing as the operation progresses.

region.description: [Output Only] URL of the region where the operation resides. Only available when performing regional operations.

selfLink.description: [Output Only] Server-defined fully-qualified URL for this resource.

startTime.description: [Output Only] The time that this operation was started by the server, in RFC3339 text format.

statusMessage.description: [Output Only] An optional textual description of the current status of the operation.

targetId.description: [Output Only] Unique target ID which identifies a particular incarnation of the target.

targetLink.description: [Output only] URL of the resource the operation is mutating.

user.description: [Output Only] User who requested the operation, for example: user@example.com.

warnings.description: [Output Only] If there are issues with this operation, a warning is returned.

code.description: [Output only] The warning type identifier for this warning.

data.description: [Output only] Metadata for this warning in key:value format.

key.description: [Output Only] Metadata key for this warning.

value.description: [Output Only] Metadata value for this warning.

message.description: [Output only] Optional human-readable details for this warning.

zone.description: [Output Only] URL of the zone where the operation resides. Only available when performing per-zone operations.

id.description: Unique identifier for the resource; defined by the server (output only).

nextPageToken.description: A token used to continue a truncated list request (output only).

selfLink.description: Server defined URL for this resource (output only).

creationTimestamp.description: The creation time of the resource view.

description.description: The detailed description of the resource view.

fingerprint.description: The fingerprint of the service endpoint information.

id.description: [Output Only] The ID of the resource view.

name.description: The name of the resource view.

network.description: The URL of a Compute Engine network to which the resources in the view belong.

resources.description: A list of all resources in the resource view.

selfLink.description: [Output Only] A self-link to the resource view.

size.description: The total number of resources in the resource view.

ServiceEndpoint.description: The service endpoint that may be started in a VM.

name.description: The name of the service endpoint.

port.description: The port of the service endpoint.

ZoneViewsAddResourcesRequest.description: The request to add resources to the resource view.

resources.description: The list of resources to be added.

fingerprint.description: The fingerprint of the service information.

ZoneViewsList.description: The response to a list request.

items.description: The result that contains all resource views that meet the criteria.

selfLink.description: Server defined URL for this resource (output only).

ZoneViewsListResourcesResponse.description: The response to a list resource request.

items.description: The formatted JSON that is requested by the user.

network.description: The URL of a Compute Engine network to which the resources in the view belong.

ZoneViewsRemoveResourcesRequest.description: The request to remove resources from the resource view.

resources.description: The list of resources to be removed.

endpoints.description: The service information to be updated.

fingerprint.description: Fingerprint of the service information; a hash of the contents. This field is used for optimistic locking when updating the service entries.

resourceName.description: The name of the resource if user wants to update the service information of the resource.

fields.name: fields
fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.name: key
key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.name: oauth_token
oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.name: prettyPrint
prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.name: quotaUser
quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

userIp.name: userIp
userIp.description: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.
